definition: falsification in writing/misrepresentation in written history/deliberate digression
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]

sentences.english: He uses a great number of deliberate digressions in this article.
sentences.chinese: 他这篇文章大量使用了曲笔手法。

sentences.english: Only researching on the mistakes of historians' records of Xiaoru's martyrdom could the historical reality be represented.
sentences.chinese: 考证史家曲笔与错误之处，才能再现孝孺殉难的真相。

definition: to use the past to disparage the present (idiom)
to borrow the past as a model for the present
the tip of a writing brush/vigor of style in writing/stroke/touch
(literary) to remonstrate with one's superior tactfully
style of writing (literary style)/way of writing a character/spelling
to add parallels and interpretations (to a story etc)/to develop and embellish/to interpret (often in a strained manner)
line drawing in traditional ink and brush style/simple and straightforward style of writing
Grand Scribe, the title by which Sima Qian 司馬遷|司马迁[Si1 ma3 Qian1] refers to himself in Records of the Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4]
